skillTree.localised_description: This Lord belts out orders and can be heard even across a battlefield smothered in the grim noise of war.
The god of money, wealth and power protects it's patrons with a shield of coins.
Foogershuis is a bank, vault and estate all in one. It is the beating heart of the Fooger operation and worth a fortune.
One of the first families part of the directorate, Clan Fooger is as reputed as they are renown within the Empire.

effects.description:
Upkeep: -50% for migrated dwarf units
	(all armies)

skillTree.localised_description: Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

effects.description: Character will share +15% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +20%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +30% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +35%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +50% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +50%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The Smiths of Guilderveld, mostly of dwarven heritage could rival any within the Empire.
Usurer's Row is the nickname for the area in Marienburg with a dense dwarven population. All either loyal or related to Arkat Fooger.
Not just a businessman, Arkat Fooger and his family specialize in the iron trade. They know their way around a mine as they know their way around a bank.
Despite being priced out by Jaan van de Kuypers, Fooger is still a very clever businessman who knows which investments will pay off and which will surely fail.
One does not simply accumulate wealth by luck, it requires skill and a keen sense to find that which holds value.

effects.description: Magic item drop chance from battle: +25%

skillTree.localised_description: House Fooger is as old as they are rich. Recent dealing however did put a massive dent in their aspirations, and Arkat has to dig deep in order to recover lost riches.
Hand-to-hand combat is a lethal match of cut and thrust. However, it’s not all about offensive strikes; parries and other defensive moves can also win the day.
Some creatures charge home with such fury that the very ground shakes beneath their feet.
Full-Plate armour protects the wearer from head-to-foot. Many such suits are blessed or imbued with arcane abilities.
The scars on this storied warrior reveal a veteran of many battles, a being not easy to kill and one worthy of respect and fear.
A deadly blade is especially lethal when in the hands of this master death-maker, killer and slaughterer!
From one bloodied, lifeless corpse to the next, this one is always looking for the next adversary to best.
Such is their power and ferocity, a wound-maker will ravage the foe, cutting and pulverising until there is only one exit - death.
This warrior is one with their blade; it is an extension of their will, making them a worthy foe in combat.
The iron will and indomitable presence of this leader ensures their followers remain steadfast when facing peril.
A blade that sings in defence will not let its wielder be penetrated.
The war is endless. The cycle of charging, clashing, and bloody hand-to-hand fighting is without end. It will never stop.
There are Lords that radiate power, confidence and fear, inspiring their followers to great or terrible acts.

effects.description:

	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: “We march to war for our Emperor, and Sigmar, our saviour and lord.”

skillTree.localised_description: Those who know the land and its secrets will travel faster and further than the foes who don't.
This Lord expects utter obedience from the smallfolk, and has little time for insurrections or petty revolts.
Revered by the masses, such a celebrated leader will inspire many new recruits.
The presence of this Lord ensures a measure of calm, reducing panic and desertion amongst followers.

	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -20% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Through our acts, the gods will cleanse the lands.
It is said that Sigmar would bear a mortal wound and carry on fighting; this champion follows the hallowed Warrior-God.

effects.description:

	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: "The time to strike is now!"

skillTree.localised_description: A good quartermaster can ration equipment and foodstuffs efficiently, making supplies last longer.
Proficient with figures, this Lord, or his subordinates, can keep his army fulfilled, even in dire circumstances.
Countless conflicts and a keen sense of awareness have made this Lord difficult to entrap.

skillTree.localised_description: "Ever thought about joining the Elector's troops, chief? You'd make a good soldier alright."

attributes.bullet_text: When bracing, this unit negates the charge bonus of any attacker.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.

effects.description: Send trade convoys across the world via the Ivory Road and navigate risks en route to reap great financial rewards
Your caravans may convince wandering dwarves to join Clan Fooger

Unit experience gain: +30% for migrated dwarf units
	(all armies)

Melee Defence: +15 for migrated dwarf units
	(all armies)

items.colour_text: The Counting House of Arkat Fooger sits well back from the canal, forming one side of a small plaza with churches to Haendryk and Verena to the right and left of it. Hundreds of people from all levels of society pass through the plaza each day, rushing from one deal to the next. Dozens of them make for the great double doors of "De Oud Foogershuis", built of imported oak and guarded night and day by four axe-wielding Dwarfs wearing the livery of the House of Fooger. Infused with Dwarven runic powers the Key to House Fooger unlocks a door clearly imported from the deep mines of Dwarven holds of old. It's power unleashes a mighty smite. Arkat rarely let's the key out of his sight, having a somewhat unhealthy obsession with it.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: The oldest, shortest and perhaps smartest of the directorate. Arkat Fooger is a shrewd businessman and warrior a like.

effects.description: Allegiance points gained: +30% for alliances with Dwarfs
